In comparison with other biologic agents, RTX has been associated with high HBVr rates also in patients with resolved HBV infection.
63, 67
– 71 In their technical review, which supported the AGA guidelines, Perrillo and colleagues calculated a pooled baseline risk estimate of HBVr at 16.9% in this group of patients, which was based on hematology/oncology studies.
17 However, in prospective or retrospective studies with patients suffering with rheumatic diseases, the rate of HBVr under RTX therapy was much lower (6/266 patients or 2%).
58, 72
– 76 Interestingly, the majority of reported patients with HBVr (4/6) came from a high-incidence HBV country (Taiwan).
